what: Note for test developers - caching DEIMS resources
title: Contributing to ReLTER
text: ReLTER repository makes use github actions checking committed code. execute tests locally, different results github action. execute tests like github actions , just set environment variable activates caching mechanism implemented ReLTER avoid timeouts github actions making requests deims.org. what: What the output of the ReLTER get_site_speciesOccurrences() is?
title: How to retrieve occurrence records by exploiting the {`ReLTER`} get_site_speciesOccurrences() function
text: user sets parameters function , choose, defines output. parameters function : user sets parameter ‚Äòdeimsid‚Äô select area interest data harvested (.e., paste DEIMS.ID site interest; e.g., Gulf Venice - GOV https://deims.org/758087d7-231f-4f07-bd7e-6922e0c283fd) user sets parameter ‚Äòlist_DS‚Äô select external data service queried (.e., ‚Äògbif‚Äô ‚Äòobis‚Äô ‚Äòinaturalist‚Äô) user sets parameter ‚Äòshow_map‚Äô get data map format addition tabular format (.e., show_map = TRUE) user sets parameter ‚Äòlimit‚Äô select records number (.e., species presence record) extracted output two type: map table(s), external data service selected. first 10 occurrence records iNaturalist selected eLTER site. first 10 occurrence records OBIS selected eLTER site.
code: # DEIMS.iD of eLTER site Gulf Of Venice (GOV) GOVid <- "https://deims.org/758087d7-231f-4f07-bd7e-6922e0c283fd"  # Compose the function with choosen parameters resGOV <- ReLTER::get_site_speciesOccurrences(   deimsid = GOVid,   list_DS = c("gbif", "inat", "obis"),   show_map = TRUE,   limit = 20 ) # iNat table knitr::kable(   resGOV$inat[c(1:10)],   caption = "The first 10 occurrence records of iNaturalist on the selected eLTER site." ) # OBIS table knitr::kable(   resGOV$obis[c(1:10)],   caption = "The first 10 occurrence records of OBIS on the selected eLTER site." )

what: How to trasform external service data schemas into eLTER data-reporting template?
title: How to retrieve occurrence records by exploiting the {`ReLTER`} get_site_speciesOccurrences() function
text: structure species occurrence records reflects exporting schema original data publisher. Fields mapping among three data source schemas (.e., GBIF, iNaturalist, OBIS) eLTER data-reporting template (Peterseil J. (2020)) carried design functions structure fetched data three simplified output data formats. output data formats result ) harmonised eLTER data-reporting requirements/template ii) readable since essential attributes maintained. Using 2 R functions, developed solve issue, data external data service can exported eLTER data-reporting template. example eLTER Saldur River Catchment site, external data service queried GBIF iNaturalist. eLTER useful archive created : biodiv_occurrence_site_97ff6180-e5d1-45f2-a559-8a7872eb26b1_gbif.zip biodiv_occurrence_site_97ff6180-e5d1-45f2-a559-8a7872eb26b1_inat.zip
code: saldurid <- "https://deims.org/97ff6180-e5d1-45f2-a559-8a7872eb26b1"  resSaldur <- ReLTER::get_site_speciesOccurrences(   deimsid = saldurid,   list_DS = c("gbif", "inat"),   show_map = FALSE,   limit = 20,   exclude_inat_from_gbif = TRUE )  # GBIF tblSaldur_gbif <- tibble::as_tibble(resSaldur$gbif) if (nrow(tblSaldur_gbif) > 0) {   outGbif <- tblSaldur_gbif %>%     ReLTER::map_occ_gbif2elter(deimsid = saldurid)   ReLTER::save_occ_eLTER_reporting_Archive(outGbif) } ## [1] "/tmp/RtmpZ5wCUE/biodiv_occurrence_site_97ff6180-e5d1-45f2-a559-8a7872eb26b1_gbif.zip" # iNaturalist tblSaldur_inat <- tibble::as_tibble(resSaldur$inat) outInat <- tblSaldur_inat %>%   ReLTER::map_occ_inat2elter(deimsid = saldurid) ReLTER::save_occ_eLTER_reporting_Archive(outInat) ## [1] "/tmp/RtmpZ5wCUE/biodiv_occurrence_site_97ff6180-e5d1-45f2-a559-8a7872eb26b1_inat.zip"

title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: docker image ReLTER package (https://github.com/ropensci/ReLTER)

title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: Run RStudio preinstalled ReLTER package Docker.

what: Install a different branch of ReLTER package
title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: Edit addReLTER.sh script modify last line, using name preferred branch ref= parameter value:
code: R -e "devtools::install_github('https://github.com/ropensci/ReLTER',ref = '<branchName>',dependencies = FALSE)"

title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
code: docker build . -t rocker_relter

title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: Run locally port 8080 (change port like). can change ‚ÄúyourpasswordW password prefer. Open browser localhost:8080 login
code: docker run -d -e PASSWORD=yourpassword -p 8080:8787 rocker_relter user: rstudio password: youpassword

what: Preserve your work (use a docker volume)
title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: stop docker container, files created within lost. order preserve work across different runs, link local volume (example, current working directory, $(pwd)) container:
code: docker run -d -v $(pwd):/home/rstudio -e PASSWORD=yourpassword -p 8080:8787 rocker_relter

title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: can also use precompiled image docker hub:
code: docker pull ptagliolato/rocker_relter docker run -d -e PASSWORD=yourpassword -p 8080:8787 ptagliolato/rocker_relter

what: Get affiliation info of the LTER site:
title: How to get the info of a (one) LTER Site by knowing the DEIMS.ID
text: aim obtain info networks/RIs site listed, can: list network(s) site listed list project(s) site listed
code: siteAffiliations <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = 'https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe',   category = 'Affiliations' ) # network(s) where the site is involved in knitr::kable(   siteAffiliations$affiliation.networks[[1]]$network,   caption = "The list of the network(s) in which the site is listed" ) # project(s) where the site is involved in knitr::kable(   siteAffiliations$affiliation.projects[[1]],   caption = "The list of the project(s) in which the site is listed" )

what: Get boundaries info of the LTER site:
title: How to get the info of a (one) LTER Site by knowing the DEIMS.ID
text: aim obtain info geographic extent covering area measurements, can:
code: siteBoundaries <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "Boundaries" )  tmap::tmap_mode("view") ## tmap mode set to interactive viewing tmap::tm_basemap("OpenStreetMap") +   tmap::tm_shape(siteBoundaries) +   tmap::tm_polygons(col = "skyblue", alpha = 0.25, border.col = "blue")

what: Get Contacts info of the LTER site:
title: How to get the info of a (one) LTER Site by knowing the DEIMS.ID
text: aim obtain info reference contact person responsible site, organisation operating site monitoring programme(s), reference organisation responsible national authority funding strategic decisions site full name person(s) organisation(s) created documentation site, can: list manager(s) site list operating organization site list metadata provider(s) site list funding agency(ies) site approach used category information. selecting category Infrastructure can obtain info : access type data policy selecting category Infrastructure can obtain info : air temperature (min, max average) precipitation (min, max average) biogeographical region biome ecosystem type eunis habitat geoBon biome geology hydrology soil vegetation
code: siteContact <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "Contacts" ) # site manager(s) knitr::kable(   siteContact$generalInfo.siteManager[[1]],   caption = "The list of the manager(s) of site" ) # operating organisation of site knitr::kable(   siteContact$generalInfo.operatingOrganisation[[1]],   caption = "The list of the operating organization of the site" ) # metadata provider(s) of site knitr::kable(   siteContact$generalInfo.metadataProvider[[1]],   caption = "The list of the metadata provider(s) of site" ) # funding agency(ies) of site knitr::kable(   siteContact$generalInfo.fundingAgency[[1]],   caption = "The list of the funding agency(ies) of site" ) siteGeneral <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "General" ) siteGeneral ## # A tibble: 1 √ó 21 ##   title    uri   geoCo‚Ä¶¬π country geoEl‚Ä¶¬≤ geoEl‚Ä¶¬≥ geoEl‚Ä¶‚Å¥ geoEl‚Ä¶‚Åµ gener‚Ä¶‚Å∂ gener‚Ä¶‚Å∑ ##   <chr>    <chr> <chr>   <list>    <dbl>   <int>   <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ## 1 Lago Ma‚Ä¶ http‚Ä¶ POINT ‚Ä¶ <chr>      194.     186    4633 msl     "Lake ‚Ä¶ Operat‚Ä¶ ## # ‚Ä¶ with 11 more variables: generalInfo.status.uri <chr>, ## #   generalInfo.yearEstablished <int>, generalInfo.yearClosed <lgl>, ## #   generalInfo.hierarchy.parent <list>, generalInfo.hierarchy.children <lgl>, ## #   generalInfo.siteName <chr>, generalInfo.shortName <chr>, ## #   generalInfo.siteType <chr>, generalInfo.protectionLevel <lgl>, ## #   generalInfo.landUse <lgl>, generalInfo.images <list>, and abbreviated ## #   variable names ¬π‚ÄãgeoCoord, ¬≤‚ÄãgeoElev.avg, ¬≥‚ÄãgeoElev.min, ‚Å¥‚ÄãgeoElev.max, ‚Ä¶ siteInfrastructure <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "Infrastructure" ) siteInfrastructure$generalInfo.collection ## [[1]] ##                collectionLabel collectionURI ## 1                  6 - 10 beds            NA ## 2                   > 5 places            NA ## 3                         Boat            NA ## 4                  Cable based            NA ## 5           Central station(s)            NA ## 6                        Paper            NA ## 7      Proprietary file format            NA ## 8          Relational database            NA ## 9  Sensor Web Enablement (SWE)            NA ## 10     Spatial data file (GIS)            NA ## 11              Telephone line            NA ## 12                XML database            NA siteEnvCharacts <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "EnvCharacts" ) siteEnvCharacts ## # A tibble: 1 √ó 26 ##   title    uri   geoCo‚Ä¶¬π country geoEl‚Ä¶¬≤ geoEl‚Ä¶¬≥ geoEl‚Ä¶‚Å¥ geoEl‚Ä¶‚Åµ envCh‚Ä¶‚Å∂ envCh‚Ä¶‚Å∑ ##   <chr>    <chr> <chr>   <list>    <dbl>   <int>   <int> <chr>     <dbl> <lgl>   ## 1 Lago Ma‚Ä¶ http‚Ä¶ POINT ‚Ä¶ <chr>      194.     186    4633 msl        12.4 NA      ## # ‚Ä¶ with 16 more variables: envCharacteristics.airTemperature.unit <chr>, ## #   envCharacteristics.airTemperature.referencePeriod <lgl>, ## #   envCharacteristics.precipitation.yearlyAverage <int>, ## #   envCharacteristics.precipitation.monthlyAverage <lgl>, ## #   envCharacteristics.precipitation.unit <chr>, ## #   envCharacteristics.precipitation.referencePeriod <lgl>, ## #   envCharacteristics.biogeographicalRegion <chr>, ‚Ä¶

what: Get list of parameters or related resources declared to the LTER site:

text: list funding agency(ies) site list funding agency(ies) site Finally want get info multiple site, please visit page.
code: siteObsProp <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "observedProperties" ) # parameter(s) collected in the site knitr::kable(   siteObsProp$observedProperties[[1]],   caption = "The list of the funding agency(ies) of site" ) siteRelateRes <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "RelateRes" ) # resource(s) related to the site (e.g. datasets, activities) knitr::kable(   siteRelateRes$relatedResources[[1]],   caption = "The list of the funding agency(ies) of site" )

title: How to get the list of contacts from list of DEIMS ID within csv file
text: obtain list contacts site List contacts
code: library(dplyr) site_results <- read.csv("./data/site_contacts_data.csv", sep = ";") %>%   dplyr::as_tibble() %>%    dplyr::mutate(url = paste0("https://deims.org/", DEIMS.ID))  contacts <- site_results$url %>%   purrr::map_dfr(.f = function(x) {     x %>% ReLTER::get_site_info(category = "Contacts") %>%       dplyr::select(title, uri, generalInfo.siteManager, geoCoord) %>%       tidyr::unnest()   }) %>%   dplyr::mutate(     site = paste0("[", title, "](", uri, ")"),     contact = paste0("[", name, "](mailto:", email, ")")   ) %>%   unique()  # Contacts table knitr::kable(   (contacts %>% dplyr::select(site, contact)),   caption = "List of the contacts",   booktabs = TRUE, longtable = TRUE )

library(dplyr) site_results_geo <- sf::st_as_sf( contacts, wkt = "geoCoord" ) listItaSitesMap <- leaflet::leaflet(site_results_geo) %>% leaflet::addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.PositronNoLabels", group = "Basemap", layerId = 123) %>% leaflet::addTiles("http://{s}.basemaps.cartocdn.com/light_only_labels/{z}/{x}/{y}.png") %>% leaflet::addCircleMarkers( data = site_results_geo, radius = 3, weight = 2, opacity = 0.5, fill = TRUE, fillOpacity = 0.2, popup = paste0( 'eLTER site:

what: Get general information of the network‚Äôs sites:
title: How to get the info of many than one LTER Sites
text: Knowing network elTER id (DEIMS ID Network, e.g.¬†LTER-Italy https://deims.org/network/7fef6b73-e5cb-4cd2-b438-ed32eb1504b3), get_network_sites can download general info, name, DEIMS.iD coordinates sites belonging network selected. map sites can returned. list site LTER-Italy network
code: library(dplyr)  listItaSites <- ReLTER::get_network_sites(  networkDEIMSID =    "https://deims.org/network/7fef6b73-e5cb-4cd2-b438-ed32eb1504b3" ) %>%   dplyr::filter(!grepl('^IT', title))  knitr::kable(   listItaSites[1:10, ],   caption = "The list of site for LTER-Italy network" ) listItaSitesMap <- leaflet::leaflet(listItaSites) %>%   leaflet::addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.PositronNoLabels",                             group = "Basemap",                             layerId = 123) %>%   leaflet::addTiles("http://{s}.basemaps.cartocdn.com/light_only_labels/{z}/{x}/{y}.png") %>%   leaflet::addCircleMarkers(     data = listItaSites,     radius = 3,     weight = 2,     opacity = 0.5,     fill = TRUE,     fillOpacity = 0.2   ) listItaSitesMap

what: Get other information of the network‚Äôs sites:
title: How to get the info of many than one LTER Sites
text: Another 4 functions implemented obtain network‚Äôs sites information. functions get specific information: Environmental characteristics get_network_envcharacts Observed properties get_network_observedProperties Related resources get_network_related_resources following example perform request get related resources (e.g.¬†activities, datasets, etc.) network. output table containing title, id time stamp last changes related resources shared network‚Äôs sites. list site LTER-Italy network
code: listRelatedResources <- ReLTER::get_network_related_resources(   networkDEIMSID = "https://deims.org/network/7fef6b73-e5cb-4cd2-b438-ed32eb1504b3" )  # Table of the network's related resources knitr::kable(   listRelatedResources,   caption = "The list of site for LTER-Italy network" )

title: How to get the info of many than one LTER Sites
text: Starting list LTER-Italy network‚Äôs sites (see first example ), using DEIMS ID list, get_site_info function (already described ). example proposed selection, list LTER-Italy sites, lakes environments map sites made. Using LTER-Italy sites list, next example provide contact list lake site managers. List contacts
code: library(dplyr) sites <- as_tibble(   listItaSites ) %>%   filter(grepl("Lago", title)) %>%   filter(!row_number() %in% c(1, 21, 22))  allSiteBound <- lapply(     as.list(       sites$uri     ),     ReLTER::get_site_info,     category = "Boundaries"   )  # Map sites_map <- leaflet::leaflet(allSiteBound) %>%   leaflet::addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.PositronNoLabels",                             group = "Basemap",                             layerId = 123) %>%   leaflet::addTiles("http://{s}.basemaps.cartocdn.com/light_only_labels/{z}/{x}/{y}.png")  groups <- length(allSiteBound)  for (i in 1:groups) {   site_polygon <- allSiteBound[[i]]   sites_map <- sites_map %>%     leaflet::addPolygons(       data = site_polygon,       popup = ~ title,       group = i     ) } sites_map library(dplyr) sites <- as_tibble(   listItaSites ) %>%   filter(grepl("Lago", title)) %>%   filter(!row_number() %in% c(1, 21, 22))  allSiteContact <- lapply(     as.list(       sites$uri     ),     ReLTER::get_site_info,     category = "Contacts"   ) contacts <- tibble::tibble(   siteName = NA,   managerName = NA,   managerEmail = NA,   managerORCID = NA ) for (i in seq_len(length(allSiteContact))) {   contacts <- contacts %>%      tibble::add_row(       siteName = allSiteContact[[i]]$title,       managerName = allSiteContact[[i]]$generalInfo.siteManager[[1]]$name,       managerEmail = allSiteContact[[i]]$generalInfo.siteManager[[1]]$email,       managerORCID = allSiteContact[[i]]$generalInfo.siteManager[[1]]$orcid     ) } # Contacts table knitr::kable(   contacts,   caption = "List of the contacts" )

what: An Interface for the eLTER Community
title: An Interface for the eLTER Community
text: ReLTER R package provides access DEIMS-SDR, allowing interact software implemented eLTER Research Infrastructure (RI) improving data/information shared among Long Term Ecological Research (LTER) network. package conceived within eLTER H2020 project help advance development European Long-Term Ecosystem Research Infrastructures (eLTER RI). ReLTER package functions particular allows : retrieve information entities (e.g.¬†sites, datasets, activities) shared DEIMS-SDR (see e.g. get_site_info function); elaborate information single site merge info national network sites entire International LTER (ILTER) order provide maps, figures, graphs etc (see e.g. get_network_sites, produce_site_map produce_site_observedProperties_pie functions); interact ODSEurope managed members Geo-harmonizer project starting dataset shared DEIMS-SDR (see e.g. get_site_ODS function); improve quality dataset (see e.g. get_id_worms). Functions currently implemented derived discussion needs declared eLTER users community. ReLTER package follow progress eLTER-RI infrastructure evolve improvements development new tools.

what: ReLTER: An Interface for the 'eLTER' Community ‚Äî ReLTER-package
title: ReLTER: An Interface for the 'eLTER' Community ‚Äî ReLTER-package
text: ReLTER provides access DEIMS-SDR (https://deims.org/), allows interaction data software implemented eLTER Research Infrastructure (RI) thus improving data sharing among European LTER projects. ReLTER uses R language access interact DEIMS-SDR archive information shared Long Term Ecological Research (LTER) network. package grew within eLTER H2020 major project help advance development European Long-Term Ecosystem Research Infrastructures (eLTER RI - https://elter-ri.eu). ReLTER package functions particular allow : - retrieve information entities (e.g. sites, datasets, activities) shared DEIMS-SDR (see e.g. get_site_info function); - interact [ODSEurope](maps.opendatascience.eu) starting dataset shared [DEIMS-SDR](https://deims.org/) (see e.g. [get_site_ODS](https://docs.ropensci.org/ReLTER/reference/get_site_ODS.html) function); - use eLTER site informations download crop geospatial data platforms (see e.g. get_site_ODS function); - improve quality dataset (see e.g. get_id_worms). Functions currently implemented derived discussions needs among eLTER users community. ReLTER package continue follow progress eLTER-RI evolve, adding new tools improvements required.

what: Obtain a list of all Environmental Characteristics of ILTER sites. ‚Äî get_ilter_envcharacts
title: Obtain a list of all Environmental Characteristics of ILTER sites. ‚Äî get_ilter_envcharacts
text: function obtains Environmental Characteristics: title, URI, geo-coordinates, country name, elevation ILTER sites (1200 around world), DEIMS-SDR API. function gathers unique tibble Environmental Characteristics ILTER sites. title: Download information of all ILTER sites or a subset of ILTER sites. ‚Äî get_ilter_generalinfo
code: if (FALSE) { # list of the all sites info with ILTER listOfAllSites <- get_ilter_generalinfo() length(listOfAllSites[,1])  # example about country name parameter sitesAustria <- get_ilter_generalinfo(country_name = "Austri") # (matches Austria, but not Australia) length(sitesAustria$title)  # example of single site in a country eisenwurzen <- get_ilter_generalinfo(   country_name = "Austri",   site_name = "Eisen" ) eisenwurzen[,1:2] # extract DEIMS.Id eisenwurzen_deimsid <- eisenwurzen$uri eisenwurzen_deimsid  # example of single site in a country and return only map get_ilter_generalinfo(   country_name = "Italy",   site_name = "Maggiore",   show_map = TRUE ) }

title: Obtain the observed properties measured by a sensor. ‚Äî get_sensor_observed_properties
text: sosURL character. endpoint Sensor Observation Service (SOS) service. procedure character. procedure/sensor ID.

title: Obtain the observed properties measured by a sensor. ‚Äî get_sensor_observed_properties
text: output function tibble labels URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) observed property, code URI Units Measurement (UOM) observed properties declared Sensor Observation Service (SOS). Codes URIs stated QUDT.org also present. QUDT public charity nonprofit organization founded provide semantic specifications units measure, quantity kind, dimensions data types. NB function returns valued string case UOM refers NERC vocabulary term (e.g. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P06/current/UPAA/ ¬∞C).

text: Alessandro Oggioni, phD oggioni.@irea.cnr.

code: if (FALSE) { FP <- get_sensor_observed_properties(   sosURL = "http://getit.lteritalia.it/observations/service",   procedure = "http://www.get-it.it/sensors/getit.lteritalia.it/procedure/noOwnerDeclared/noModelDeclared/noSerialNumberDeclared/1286194C-A5DF-11DF-8ED7-1602DFD72097" ) FP  eurac_monalisa <- get_sensor_observed_properties(   sosURL = "http://monalisasos.eurac.edu/sos/service",   procedure = "QuantumSensor_nemef2000" ) eurac_monalisa  obsProsAir <- get_sensor_observed_properties(   sosURL = "http://getit.lteritalia.it/observations/service",   procedure = "http://www.get-it.it/sensors/getit.lteritalia.it/procedure/noOwnerDeclared/noModelDeclared/noSerialNumberDeclared/SI000049-1675AirTemp" ) obsProsAir  NIVA <- get_sensor_observed_properties(   sosURL = "https://hydro-sos.niwa.co.nz/",   procedure = "Hydrometric_Station" ) NIVA }

title:
Acquire various raster layers from
ODS Europe
and crops to an eLTER site boundary. ‚Äî get_site_ODS
text: function returns SpatRaster object (terra package) requested dataset, cropped site boundaries user save raster disk, necessary. .e. writeRaster(ds_site, "site_dataset.tif")

title:
Acquire various raster layers from
ODS Europe
and crops to an eLTER site boundary. ‚Äî get_site_ODS
text: Supported datasets ODS repository include: Landcover: Land-cover class according highest probability, generated spatiotemporal ensemble-ML model. 30 m. resolution CLC2018: Corine land cover rasterized 100m spatial resolution provided Copernicus Land Monitoring Service. OSM buildings: Buildings according OSM polygons Copernicus impervious build-layer (2018), aggregated rasterized first 10m spatial resolution downsampled 30m spatial average. Natura2000: Protected areas rasterized NATURA 2000 (, B C site categories) OSM (IUCN Ia, IUCN Ib, IUCN 2, IUCN 3, IUCN 4, IUCN 5, IUCN 6 others categories), first 10m spatial resolution downsampled 30m spatial average. overlap areas indicated new category. NDVI:  NDVI time-series, derived Landsat quarterly temporal composites NDVI Trend 2000 - 2019 OLS regression Forests: Broadleaf, coniferous mixed forests datasets georeferenced EPSG:3035 coordinate reference system. except clc2018 30 meters resolution

title: Trims by eLTER site the species occurrence from different sources ‚Äî get_site_speciesOccurrences
text: deimsid character. DEIMS.iD site DEIMS-SDR website. DEIMS.iD information . list_DS character. Data source get data , combination gbif, inat /obis. show_map boolean. TRUE Leaflet map occurrences shown. Default FALSE. limit numeric. Number records return. passed across sources. Default: 500 source. BEWARE: lot species query (e.g., n = 10), 10 * 500 = 5000, can take collect. , first query, set limit something smallish can get result quickly, needed. exclude_inat_from_gbif boolean. TRUE, list_DS contains "gbif" "inat", filter gbif records originating iNaturalist (order avoid duplicates). Default TRUE.

what: Obtain the observations from a Sensor Observation Service (SOS). ‚Äî get_sos_obs
title: Obtain the observations from a Sensor Observation Service (SOS). ‚Äî get_sos_obs
text: function obtains observations shared Sensor Observation Service (SOS).

title: Obtain the observations from a Sensor Observation Service (SOS). ‚Äî get_sos_obs
code: get_sos_obs(sosURL, procedure, foi = NULL, show_map = FALSE)

title: Obtain the observations from a Sensor Observation Service (SOS). ‚Äî get_sos_obs
text: sosURL character. endpoint Sensor Observation Service (SOS) service. procedure character. procedure/sensor ID. Possible value Feature Interest(FOI) ID, can obtained via get_sos_procedure_info() function. foi character. parameter selects Feature(s) Interest (FOI(s)) retrieved returned observations. Possible value FOI(s) ID, can obtained via get_sos_foi() function. FOI parameter set, observations reached FOIs sensor, downloaded. Note request time may long! Multiple values can indicated. Default NA. show_map logical. TRUE boundary plotted Leaflet map. Default FALSE.

title: Obtain the observations from a Sensor Observation Service (SOS). ‚Äî get_sos_obs
text: output function tibble. output can divided two parts: columns concerning observations ancillary information concerning observations made. first part, usually starting date time values, contains columns representing observed properties (e.g. air temperature) measured sensor. second part contains columns : Feature(s) Interest - FOI ( foiLabel foiID), identifier observations block (obsBlockID), procedure/sensor (procedureID procedureName), sampling feature (typeSf, description, name), sampled feature id (sampledFeature), coordinate reference system code (srsName) coordinates (lon lat). map can obtained indicating parameter show_map TRUE. output contains also semantic link, provided SOS. uri attribute contains URIs terms indicated headers columns. observed properties columns labeled unit measurement, mentioned SOS, using R package units. labelling simplify propagation, conversion derivation units collected observed properties.

title: Obtain the observations from a Sensor Observation Service (SOS). ‚Äî get_sos_obs
text: Alessandro Oggioni, phD oggioni.@irea.cnr.Paolo Tagliolato, phD tagliolato.p@irea.cnr.

text: deimsid character. DEIMS ID network DEIMS-SDR website. DEIMS ID information . countryCode character following 3166-1 alpha-3 codes. List sites specific network. list needed showing another points map. gridNx double. numeric vector unit object specifying x-location viewports country provided countryCode parameter. gridNy double. numeric vector unit object specifying y-location viewports country provided countryCode parameter. width double. numeric vector unit object specifying width viewports country provided countryCode parameter. Default 0.25. height double. numeric vector unit object specifying height viewports country provided countryCode parameter. Default 0.25. bboxXMin double. numeric add unit bbox provided centroid site. Default 0. bboxXMax double. numeric add unit bbox provided centroid site. Default 0. bboxYMin double. numeric add unit bbox provided centroid site. Default 0. bboxYMax double. numeric add unit bbox provided centroid site. Default 0. show_map boolean. TRUE immage map plotted. Default FALSE.

code: produce_zenodo_record(   mytoken,   myfiles,   delim,   upload_rdata = FALSE,   record_type = "dataset",   record_title,   record_description,   record_authors,   record_license = "CC-BY-SA-4.0",   record_accessRight = "open",   record_version = "1.0",   record_language = "eng",   record_keywords,   record_relatedIdentifier,   record_communities = c("lter-italy", "elter"),   record_grants,   record_publish = FALSE )

title: Create a record in Zenodo ‚Äî produce_zenodo_record
text: mytoken character. Scopes assign permissions personal access token. personal access token works just like normal OAuth access token authentication API. token can created application page. myfiles character. list file(s) deposit Zenodo. delim character. Provide character used separate fields within record. want upload Zenodo dataset (see param record_type ) extension 'csv', 'tsv' 'txt' want upload also copy dataset Rdata format (see param upload_rdata ). upload_rdata logical.  want also upload version dataset RData format onto record? Default FALSE. record_type character. type record among following values: 'publication', 'poster', 'presentation', 'dataset', 'image', 'video', 'software', 'lesson', 'physicalobject', ''. Default 'dataset'. record_title character. title record. record_description character. description record. record_authors tibble. list creator(s) record. approach use firstname, lastname, affiliation, orcid authors record. Please follow example. record_license character. license record released. license set Zenodo id license. Default "CC--SA-4.0". supported licenses values https://opendefinition.org https://spdx.org. record_accessRight character. Default "open". options : 'embargoed', 'restricted' 'closed'. record_version character. version record. Default "1.0". record_language character. language record. one value possible. Default "eng". record_keywords character. multiple values possible. keyword record record. record_relatedIdentifier tibble. related entities (e.g. scientific paper, data paper, etc.) detaset. tibble composed 2 variables: relation identifier. Relation can one among following values: "isCitedBy", "cites", "isSupplementTo", "isSupplementedBy", "isNewVersionOf", "isPreviousVersionOf", "isPartOf", "hasPart", "compiles", "isCompiledBy", "isIdenticalTo", "isAlternateIdentifier". identifier type identifier (e.g. DOI). record_communities character. name communities created Zenodo. multiple values possible. Default "lter-italy" "elter". record_grants character. multiple values possible. Put list project identifier well showed European Commission via OpenAIRE. record_publish logical. State whether Zenodo record published. parameter publish can set TRUE (use CAUTIOUSLY, want publish record). Default FALSE.

title: Create a record in Zenodo from eLTER data reporting format ‚Äî produce_zenodo_record_from_elter_reporting
code: if (FALSE) { ## Not run:  deimsid <- "https://deims.org/8eda49e9-1f4e-4f3e-b58e-e0bb25dc32a6" time_span <- 2015 # e.g. whole year time_span <- "20150302-20180415" # e.g. span between two dates data_topic <- "VEG" # data provider defined abbreviation of "vegetation" variable_group <- "SPECCOVER" # data provider defined abbreviation version <- "V20220907"  filename <- reporting_compose_file_name(   deimsid = deimsid,   data_topic = data_topic,   variable_group = variable_group,   time_span = time_span,   version = version )  data <- dplyr::tribble(   ~id, ~value,    1, 7.5,    2, 4.2 ) station <- dplyr::tribble(   ~SITE_CODE, ~STATION_CODE, ~STYPE, ~LAT,      ~LON,       ~ALTITUDE,   deimsid,    "IP2",         "AREA",  45.340805, 7.88887495, 265 ) method <- dplyr::tribble(   ~VARIABLE, ~METH_DESCR,   "COVE_F",  "Analysis of ammonium..."   )    research_object <- reporting_produce_data_object_v1.3(  filename = filename,  deimsid = deimsid,  data = data,  station = station,  method = method )  authors <- tibble::tibble(   name = c("Luke", "Leia"),   surname = c("Skywalker", "Organa"),   affiliation = c("Tatooine", "Alderaan"),   orcid = c("0000-0002-7997-219X", "0000-0002-7997-219X") ) keywords <- c("Star Wars", "species", "films", "planets") relatedIdentifiers <- tibble::tibble(   relation = c("isSupplementTo", "isPartOf"),   identifier = c("10.1038/s4150-01-0032", "10.1016/j.2051.06.026") ) grants <- c("871128", "654359", "871126")  produce_zenodo_record_from_elter_reporting(   x = research_object,   saveRDS = TRUE,   filepath = ".",   filename = filename,   mytoken = mytoken, # generate your Zenodo token   record_title = "The title of eLTER reporting",   record_description = "This is the description of the record of eLTER data     reporting format.",   record_authors = authors,   record_license = "CC-BY-SA-4.0",   record_accessRight = "open",   record_version = "1.0",   record_language = "eng",   record_keywords = keywords,   record_relatedIdentifier = relatedIdentifiers,   record_communities = "lter-italy",   record_grants = grants ) }  ## End (Not run)

title: eLTER reporting format naming convention for files ‚Äî reporting_compose_file_name
code: reporting_compose_file_name(   deimsid = NULL,   country_code = NULL,   site_name = NULL,   data_topic,   variable_group = "",   time_span,   version = Sys.Date() %>% format("V%Y%m%d") )

title: eLTER reporting format naming convention for files ‚Äî reporting_compose_file_name
text: deimsid character DEIMS ID site DEIMS-SDR website. information DEIMS ID pages: page. country_code character automatically evaluated DEIMS ID provided. Otherwise reference country site two-digit country code according ISO 3166-1 alpha-2. site_name character Automatically evaluated DEIMS ID provided. Otherwise name site according DEIMS-SDR, name long site name can shortened. data_topic character. Max 5-digit code data topic observation programme, e.g. METEO (Meteorology), BIODIV (Biodiversity), DEPO (deposition), GHG (Green House gas), SW (Soil water), VEG (Vegetation). abbreviation defined data provider depending data. variable_group character. Optional, list variables variable groups contained data. abbreviation defined data provider depending data. time_span numeric character. Time span covered data. version version format "VYYYYMMDD". Data version format ‚ÄúV‚ÄùYYYYMMDD. Defaults current date.

code: if (FALSE) { ## Not run:  deimsid <- "https://deims.org/8eda49e9-1f4e-4f3e-b58e-e0bb25dc32a6" time_span <- 2015 # e.g. whole year # time_span <- "20150302-20180415" # e.g. span between two dates data_topic <- "VEG" # data provider defined abbreviation of "vegetation" variable_group <- "SPECCOVER" # data provider defined abbreviation version <- "V20220907"  filename <- reporting_compose_file_name(   deimsid = deimsid,   data_topic = data_topic,   variable_group = variable_group,   time_span = time_span,   version = version )  data <- dplyr::tribble(   ~id, ~value,   1, 7.5,   2, 4.2 ) station <- dplyr::tribble(   ~SITE_CODE, ~STATION_CODE, ~STYPE, ~LAT,      ~LON,       ~ALTITUDE,   deimsid,    "IP2",         "AREA",  45.340805, 7.88887495, 265 )  method <- dplyr::tribble(   ~VARIABLE, ~METH_DESCR,   "COVE_F",  "Analysis of ammonium..."  )  research_object <- reporting_produce_data_object_v1.3(  filename = filename,  deimsid = deimsid,  data = data,  station = station,  method = method )  archive <- reporting_save_archive(   x = research_object,   # obtained from the function `reporting_produce_data_object_v1.3()`   filename = filename,   # obtained from the function `reporting_compose_file_name()`   filepath = ".",   saveRDS = TRUE )  ## End (Not run) }

Click ‚ÄúFile‚Äù ‚ÄúSave ‚Äù. new popup displays,  select ‚ÄúANSI‚Äù ‚ÄúEncoding‚Äù field. Click ‚ÄúSave‚Äù. Now, able open file Excel display characters correctly. Solution 2 - Open Excel Click ‚ÄúFile‚Äù ‚ÄúNew‚Äù Click ‚ÄúData‚Äù tab Click ‚ÄúText‚Äù select CSV file Select ‚ÄúDelimited‚Äù ‚ÄúFile origin‚Äù, select ‚Äú65001 : Unicode (UTF-8)‚Äù Click ‚ÄúNext‚Äù Select ‚ÄúComma‚Äù Click ‚ÄúFinish‚Äù Excel now show CSV file display characters correctly.

title: eLTER taxon_id_worms_refine ‚Äî taxon_id_worms_refine
text: internal function provides refining output function taxon_id_worms. prints list possible matches possibly enables user interactively make choice.

title: eLTER taxon_id_worms_refine ‚Äî taxon_id_worms_refine
code: taxon_id_worms_refine(   input,   taxaColumn = 1,   interaction = FALSE,   choiceNumber = NULL )

title: eLTER taxon_id_worms_refine ‚Äî taxon_id_worms_refine
text: input tibble. output taxon_ID_Worms. taxaColumn numeric. cardinal number column species list . Default 1. interaction boolean. TRUE user can interact choice one proposed matching. Default FALSE. choiceNumber numeric. number selected choice. Default NULL. NULL choice performed.

title: eLTER taxon_id_worms_refine ‚Äî taxon_id_worms_refine
text: interactive mode choiceNumber NULL output function tibble refinement input, else function simply returns unchanged input.
